data.title: Communications Director, Disney Consumer Products EMEA at DISNEY
data.meta_description: Learn more about applying for Communications Director, Disney Consumer Products EMEA at DISNEY
data.text:
Communications Director, Disney Consumer Products EMEA

Overall Purpose of the Role

Disney Consumer Products (DCP) brings the Disney, Pixar, MARVEL, Star Wars, National Geographic and 20th Century brands into the lives of families and fans in region through innovative products and experiences.

The Director will lead all aspects of communications for DCP EMEA including PR, internal communications, executive engagement, issues management and B2B communications. In addition to developing and executing high impact PR strategies to drive the DCP business, the Director will liaise with the wider communications teams across The Walt Disney Company to unlock synergy support for key campaigns, and identify relevant partnerships externally, complementing the work of integrated marketing/promotions.

An excellent strategist with strong creative flair, the Director will inspire the team to deliver campaigns that drive earned media across the region and beyond. With a strong network of press contacts, they will lead by example on media relations, continually looking at new ways to deliver great stories and drive social buzz around Disney’s brands and products. A natural collaborator, they will work across the business to represent and deliver integrated communications campaigns– always keeping commercial goals front and centre.

Overall Responsibilities

Primary communications “client manager” for DCP leadership in EMEA

Primary point of contact within DCP for corresponding communications teams in the US and in-markets

Build communication strategies tied to long term issues facing the business

Support the local markets when issues arise and manage communications with relevant stakeholders across the business

Ensure all campaigns are leveraged with our key B2B audiences to maximise commercial value

Determine and prioritise communications activations at a regional and UK level

Develop strategic and long term (12-18 month) plans and tools for the markets to budget and activate locally while providing guidance for target audiences and KPIs

Lead reporting and analysis of all local, regional and global activities within DCP EMEA for distribution to the regional and global leadership

Liaise with all internal teams to manage DCP product recall or IP leaks issues (global, EMEA corporate, product integrity, legal etc.)

Monitor the news agenda closely and demonstrate a good understanding of the industry

Ensure systems are in place to evaluate consumer engagement and sentiment around issues via social media to put in place appropriate response

Work to proactively troubleshoot issues providing advice and guidance to the business

Executive Support

Provide support to DCP EMEA leadership team on all aspects of communications including presentations, speech writing, internal communications and messaging documents

Ensure that the DCP leadership team is kept fully informed on coverage, potential issues and, as appropriate, competitor activity

Provide guidance and professional expertise to support the development of internal communications for DCP EMEA, including Town Halls and wider team meetings

Work with executives to support the development of their external commercial profiles.

Work alongside DCP EMEA commercial teams to evaluate and ensure that all activities are delivered in a way which supports the external brand image of TWDC

Internal Communications

Oversee robust internal communications programme with Comms Manager for DCP EMEA; partner where necessary with other Comms teams within EMEA and NAM as required to deliver programme e.g. Town Halls, content for internal platforms.

Issues Management/Corporate Communications

Offer advice and guidance to the DCP leadership team on issues that arise providing messaging, internal announcements and press statements and recommendations on the best/most appropriate platforms on which to communicate both internally and externally; liaise as needed with other TWDC/DCP Comms teams

Communication Strategy and Campaign Planning

Work with marketing to develop annual strategic communications plans that reflect the overall segment Annual Operating Plans

Work with brand commercialisation, marketing, and category leadership to understand strategic priorities and identify areas of growth potential before developing innovative communications campaigns to drive the business

Determine and develop annual budget requirements and ensure budgets are appropriately tracked/managed throughout the year

Ensure creative campaign strategies meet business objectives and set KPIs for specific campaigns and teams

Build relationships across the business in EMEA and globally to maximise business impact of campaigns

Work with the markets to ensure planning cycles are aligned and plans are delivered from the regional team in a timely manner

Review campaign performance and identify lessons that can be used to enhance the success of future activities

Campaign delivery

Develop strategic media engagement programmes around key campaigns to maximise business impact

Approve all media materials including press releases, Q&A documents, presentations, statements and speeches

Maintain excellent media relationships with key reporters and liaise with senior journalists to deliver on message coverage and manage the media agenda as appropriate

Oversee PR events ensuring successful delivery

Develop briefs for third-party agencies, lead pitches and negotiate costs working with procurement and legal as necessary

Manage relationships with external agencies, guide them on delivering the best results and ensure appropriate service levels/value for money

Experience and Professional Qualifications Required

Significant communications experience in a leadership role within a blue-chip brand-led organisation and/or PR firm

Proven experience of devising and implementing internal communications programmes

Strong track record of supporting a leadership team on all aspects of communications, including the development of external profiles, speech-writing, media training etc.

Understanding of the global media landscape and strong media strategy skills

Outstanding network of media contacts across Europe (Trade and Consumer) and the ability to confidently handle media issues

Experience of leading and developing a team

Skills Required

Excellent oral/written communication and presentation skills

Disciplined organisational skills in all aspects of job performance with strong attention to detail

Ability to juggle and prioritise multiple projects and execute quickly while maintaining set list of priorities and focus

Flexibility, resourcefulness and an ability to thrive in a fast-paced, changing and growing environment

Ability to influence people/lead in a matrixed organisation and build strong internal/external relationships

Creative spark, strategic vision and the ability to devise and deliver compelling communication strategies

High level of corporate professionalism, maturity and political savvy

Additional information

This role requires you to be in Hammersmith 4 days per week

Flexibility for occasional UK, European or international travel may be required

Flexible hours may be required to meet business needs

About Disney Experiences:

Disney Experiences brings the magic of Disney stories and franchises to life through theme parks, resorts, cruise ships, unique vacation experiences, products and more around the world. Disney shines in the travel industry with six resort destinations in the United States, Europe and Asia; a top-rated cruise line; a popular vacation ownership program; and an award-winning guided family adventure business. Plus, Disney's global consumer products operations include the world's leading licensing business; the world's largest children's publishing brands; one of the world's largest licensors of games across all platforms; and Disney store locations around the world and on the web.

About The Walt Disney Company:

The Walt Disney Company, together with its subsidiaries and affiliates, is a leading diversified international family entertainment and media enterprise that includes three core business segments: Disney Entertainment, ESPN, and Disney Experiences. From humble beginnings as a cartoon studio in the 1920s to its preeminent name in the entertainment industry today, Disney proudly continues its legacy of creating world-class stories and experiences for every member of the family. Disney’s stories, characters and experiences reach consumers and guests from every corner of the globe. With operations in more than 40 countries, our employees and cast members work together to create entertainment experiences that are both universally and locally cherished.

This position is with The Walt Disney Company Limited, which is part of a business we call Disney Experiences.

The Walt Disney Company Limited is an equal opportunity employer. Applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, race, colour, religion or belief, sex, nationality, ethnic or national origin, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, marital or civil partner status, disability or pregnancy or maternity. Disney fosters a business culture where ideas and decisions from all people help us grow, innovate, create the best stories and be relevant in a rapidly changing world.
